intro: Spergularia macrotheca var. longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled sandspurry, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland dunes. This variety is distinguished by its elongated style, which is a key feature in its taxonomy and pollination strategy.
